pros: well paid, opportunity to travel, well funded
cons: very poor office space, HR can be slow

job_title: Marketing Manager in New York, NY
pros:
- Good benefits (especially if you have children)
- Decent allowances
cons:
- No room for growth (5+ years with no promotion).
- Lack of real compassionate leadership with no transparency.
- Burnout campus-wide among admin staff (most of my colleagues were in therapy for work-related stress).
- Retaliation runs rampet (most employees work in a constant state of fear).
- Pay inequality is some of the worst I have seen.
- Operates very differently than NYU New York.

job_title: PhD Graduate Student in New York, NY
pros: Tons of access to professors and postdocs. No need to constantly seek funding as they provide automatic funding for the global phd program (bonus they provide housing for free on top of salary and TAing can give you even more money) . Research seems to be well funded and easy to access.
cons: Pretty much no options in choosing your classes. Harder to do an appropriate job search in my home country since I will be in Abu Dhabi for most of it. Doing a PhD across two countries means an exponential increase in bureaucracy

job_title: Student Worker in New York, NY
pros: great place for freshman to gain experience
cons: a little stressful for freshman, need to work extra hard

job_title: Student Worker in New York, NY
pros: Great Office. Good Downtime. Free Food.
